Posts.Content: Aug 19, 2016 10:19PM DakotaGirl wrote: It is tempting to just try it and hope for the best, isn't it!? I'm in so much pain that I need to take action. Just can't decide which! I have rules out the back muscle though
Posts.Title: Implants after Radiation Therapy DakotaGirl BayouBabe

Posts.Content: DakotaGirl wrote: I'm curious if there are any success stories of implant reconstruction after rads. I finished rads March 2015, and my Doctor FINALLY has given the okay to attempt reconstruction. I had previous implants for years prior to diagnosis, and the radiated side is now encapsulated, with fibrosis and very painful. I was given the option of relocating my back muscle, but I really don't want to do that because I'm a very active tennis player and I need my back muscle where it is. The other option is to replace my existing implant with a new one. Is there any chance this will be successful? Has anyone healed well from this after radiation? Dx 11/19/2014, IDC, <1cm, Stage IA, Grade 1, 0/2 nodes, ER+/PR+, HER2- Dx 12/8/2014, DCIS, <1cm, Stage 0, Grade 3, 0/2 nodes, ER+/PR+, HER2- Surgery 12/17/2014 Lumpectomy: Right; Lymph node removal: Right, Sentinel Radiation Therapy 2/5/2015 Whole-breast: Breast, Lymph nodes Log in to post a reply
